docs.name: Commodity Imports - Organic Chemicals / Penicillins, derivatives, in bulk, salts - Dominica
docs.description: The United Nations Commodity Trade Statistics Database (UN Comtrade) stores more than 1 billion trade data records from 1962. Over 140 reporter countries provide the United Nations Statistics Division with their annual international trade statistics detailed by commodities and partner countries. These data are subsequently transformed into the United Nations Statistics Division standard format with consistent coding and valuation using the UN/OECD CoprA internal processing system.

docs.name: Road share of inland freight transport  : Latvia
docs.description:
This indicator is defined as the percentage of each mode (road, rail and inland waterways) in total inland freight transport performance measured in tonne-kilometres.
Inland freight transport includes road, rail and inland waterways:
- Rail and inland waterways transport are based on movements on national territory (‘territoriality principle'), regardless of the nationality of the vehicle or vessel.
- Road transport is based on all movements of vehicles registered in the reporting country. 
Full metadata at: http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/tran_hv_frmod_esms.htm

docs.name: Road share of inland freight transport  : Spain
docs.description:
This indicator is defined as the percentage of each mode (road, rail and inland waterways) in total inland freight transport performance measured in tonne-kilometres.
Inland freight transport includes road, rail and inland waterways:
- Rail and inland waterways transport are based on movements on national territory (‘territoriality principle'), regardless of the nationality of the vehicle or vessel.
- Road transport is based on all movements of vehicles registered in the reporting country. 
Full metadata at: http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/tran_hv_frmod_esms.htm

sources.description:
Eurostat's mission: to be the leading provider of high quality statistics on Europe. 

Eurostat is the statistical office of the European Union situated in Luxembourg. Its task is to provide the European Union with statistics at European level that enable comparisons between countries and regions.
